quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
quotes.author: Cory House

quotes.text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
quotes.author: John Johnson

quotes.text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuchs

quotes.text: It's not a bug – it's an undocumented feature.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
quotes.author: Austin Freeman

quotes.text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
quotes.author: Kent Beck

quotes.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear simple.
quotes.author: Grady Booch

quotes.text: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve.
quotes.author: Patrick McKenzie

quotes.text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
quotes.author: Chris Pine

quotes.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
quotes.author: Martin Fowler

quotes.text: The most disastrous thing you can ever learn is your first programming language.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place.
quotes.author: Brian Kernighan

quotes.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.text: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice, there is.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
quotes.author: Ralph Johnson

quotes.text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
quotes.author: Dennis Ritchie

quotes.text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
quotes.author: Dan Salomon

quotes.text: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
quotes.author: Doug Linder

quotes.text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
quotes.author: Louis Srygley

quotes.text: One man's crappy software is another man's full-time job.
quotes.author: Jessica Gaston

quotes.text: Deleted code is debugged code.
quotes.author: Jeff Sickel

quotes.text: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.text: Your interview is not a test of your knowledge. It's a test of your ability to communicate your knowledge.
quotes.author: Gayle McDowell
